snippet: When Hurricane Sandy cut power to a Newark facility, clicking open the locks, male inmates threatened female inmates and in some cases escaped, witnesses said.
abstract: New Jersey officials report that at least male 15 inmates escaped from Logan Hall, a halfway house in Newark, NJ, after power failure caused by Hurricane Sandy allowed security locks to open; incident, one of the largest mass escapes in the recent history of the state's correction system, fuels ongoing debate over Community Education Centers, which runs the 650-bed halfway house, and appears to have done little if anything to prepare for the storm; all but one of the escapees have been recaptured.
lead_paragraph: When Hurricane Sandy cut power to a Newark facility, clicking open the locks, male inmates threatened female inmates and in some cases escaped, witnesses said.

headline.seo: 15 Inmates Escaped From New Jersey Halfway House During Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: As Storm Raged, 15 Fled New Jersey Halfway House
headline.print_headline: 15 Inmates Fled in Hurricane, Raising Questions on Security
